qas.question: Which type of construction is more expensive?
What type of boards end up with limited routing space in through-hole manufacture?
What force might damage a PCB if large components are surface mounted?
What components can be surface mounted to save space?
A component might not be able to be made any smaller because of its mechanical limitations or what other need?
What will not damage the PCB?
Mechanical signs will damage the what?
What increases the available routing area?
Large-sized SMD components were used when?

context: <a0_0><b7_0>Through-hole<a0_0/> manufacture<b7_0/> adds to board cost by requiring many holes to be drilled accurately, and limits the available routing area for signal traces on layers immediately below the top layer on <a1_0>multi-layer<a1_0/> boards since the holes must pass through all layers to the opposite side. <b8_0>Once surface-mounting came into use<b8_0/>, <a3_0>small-sized SMD components<a3_0/> were used where possible, with through-hole mounting only of components unsuitably large for surface-mounting due to <a4_0>power requirements<a4_0/> or mechanical limitations, or subject to <a2_0><b5_0>mechanical stress<b5_0/><a2_0/> which might damage the <b6_0>PCB<b6_0/>.
